title: ICE: index out of bounds when trying to use associated const in array size

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
### Code [Playground link](https://play.rust-lang.org/?version=stable&mode=debug&edition=2018&gist=e531c045b6135d1ddfd64074feaaab5d) ```Rust trait Trait { type Type; const VALUE: Self::Type; } trait TraitExt { type Array; } impl TraitExt for dyn Trait { type Array = [usize; Self::VALUE]; } ``` (I now realize that the thing I was trying to do was misguided and wrong, but hey, an ICE is an ICE.) ### Meta `rustc --version --verbose`: ``` rustc 1.46.0 (04488afe3 2020-08-24) binary: rustc commit-hash: 04488afe34512aa4c33566eb16d8c912a3ae04f9 commit-date: 2020-08-24 host: x86_64-apple-darwin release: 1.46.0 LLVM version: 10.0 ``` The bug also exists on nightly as of the time of this report. ### Error output ``` thread 'rustc' panicked at 'index out of bounds: the len is 0 but the index is 0', src/librustc_middle/ty/mod.rs:895:14 ```
Backtrace

``` 0: ::fmt 1: core::fmt::write 2: std::io::Write::write_fmt 3: std::panicking::default_hook::{{closure}} 4: std::panicking::default_hook 5: rustc_driver::report_ice 6: std::panicking::rust_panic_with_hook 7: rust_begin_unwind 8: core::panicking::panic_fmt 9: core::panicking::panic_bounds_check 10: rustc_middle::ty::Generics::param_at 11:
